title: Salesforce Administrator
description: Sweep is hiring a Salesforce Administrator, based in Paris, to make Sweep an outstanding resource for the climate community and a real driver of change for our planet.Climate change is the defining issue of our time. By empowering companies with technology that helps them manage their climate impact, we believe Sweep can make a meaningful contribution to a better future for all of us.Ok, sounds promising. What will I be doing?As Salesforce Administrator you'll play a pivotal role in ensuring its optimal performance, security, and usability for all our teams. You will report to Rachel Vincent, Sales Ops Team Lead.In this dynamic role, you'll be responsible for the day-to-day administration, ongoing development, and strategic evolution of our Salesforce instance. You'll partner closely with various departments (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Product) to understand their needs, translate them into effective Salesforce solutions, and champion best practices. You'll also be crucial in supporting the build and deployment of new Salesforce functionalities based on internal stakeholder requests.To be more specific, this includes:Key Responsibilities: Custom Object & Field Configurations: Design, create, and maintain custom objects, fields, record types, and relationships to support evolving business requirements and data structures, especially as we transition to Revenue Cloud. Automation (Flows): Develop, update, and maintain complex Salesforce Flows to automate business processes, streamline workflows, and improve operational efficiency. Data Management & Integrity: Proactively clean, de-duplicate, and maintain Salesforce data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency. Implement and enforce data validation rules and data governance policies. Partner closely with our AI & Data team to ensure clean, accurate data flows from Salesforce to Snowflake for advanced analytics and insights. Reporting & Dashboards: Design, build, and maintain custom reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights and empower data-driven decision-making for sales, marketing, and leadership teams, potentially leveraging AI-driven analytics. User Management & Security: Manage user accounts, including provisioning, deactivation, and troubleshooting login issues. Build out, maintain, and audit permissions, roles, profiles, and sharing settings to ensure appropriate data access and robust security. Connected App & Integration Management: Configure, manage, and troubleshoot Salesforce Connected Apps to facilitate secure and reliable integration with external systems, including Hubspot (for Marketing) and sales enablement tools like Cognism and Gong, ensuring optimal data flow and usability. Page Layout & UI Optimization: Optimize and clean up page layouts, Lightning pages, and user interfaces to enhance user experience and ensure essential information is easily accessible. Bug Fixes & Troubleshooting: Diagnose, resolve, and document Salesforce-related bugs and technical issues in a timely and efficient manner, focusing on root cause analysis and responding to helpdesk tickets. Release Management: Stay current with Salesforce releases and new features, including advancements in AI. Evaluate, test in sandbox environments, and implement relevant updates to leverage the latest platform capabilities. AppExchange Management: Evaluate, install, configure, and maintain managed packages and applications from the Salesforce AppExchange. Ongoing Maintenance & Governance: Perform regular system health checks, security reviews, and ongoing maintenance activities. Contribute to the development and enforcement of Salesforce governance policies and best practices. Documentation & Training: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for Salesforce processes, configurations, and solutions. Provide training and ongoing support to end-users to maximize Salesforce adoption and proficiency, including the effective use of AI tools. That sounds just right for me. What do I need to bring?Glad you asked. This is who we're looking for:Qualifications  Professional level of English, French is a plus 3-5 years of hands-on experience as a Salesforce Administrator in a B2B SaaS environment Proficiency in Salesforce Sales Cloud is essential Experience with Revenue Cloud or a strong understanding of CPQ/billing processes is highly desirable Strong understanding of Salesforce declarative configuration options (Custom Objects, Fields, Validation Rules, Workflow Rules, Flows, Page Layouts, Record Types) Demonstrated experience with Salesforce security model (Profiles, Roles, Permission Sets, OWD, Sharing Rules) Proven ability to manage data quality, including using Data Loader and other data management tools (for ETL) Experience with Connected Apps setup and management for integrations Familiarity with Salesforce AI capabilities and a keen interest in leveraging AI to optimize CRM processes Salesforce Administrator Certification (ADM 201) required; Advanced Administrator, Platform App Builder, or other relevant certifications are highly preferred.Qualities  Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills, with a keen attention to detail and a proactive approach to issue resolution Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels, and manage internal support tickets efficiently Proactive attitude towards platform enhancements and a desire to implement best practice solutions. Copy that. And what's in it for me? You will be joining an exciting young business that wants to change the world. With a proven track record in starting companies, we're hitting the ground running and aim to have an impact fast. Joining this journey allows you to grow with us, own your role, and really help shape our path.You will join a dynamic team of engineers, business minds, creatives and carbon experts spread across Europe and beyond. We're a fun bunch of people that want to work hard and enjoy ourselves while doing so. We believe in creating a calm environment that knows that life is not just work, and we'll all be doing better work because of that.We're big believers in creating successful businesses that are good for everyone, including society and the planet. That's why we're an "Entreprise à Mission" and a Certified B Corp.We think this might be the ride of our lives. And hopefully yours, too.Department General & Admin Role Sales Ops Locations Paris Remote status Hybrid Yearly salary €50,000 - €60,000 Employment type Full-time

title: Front End Engineer
description: Gorgias is the conversational AI platform for ecommerce that drives sales and resolves support inquiries. Trusted by over 15,000 ecommerce brands, Gorgias supports growing independent shops to globally recognizable brands. Built for Shopify and powered by advanced ecommerce integrations, Gorgias's conversational AI understands your brand, tools, policies, and customers to drive personalized, 1-to-1 conversations - from editing orders and initiating returns to making product recommendations. Gorgias, where every customer interaction feels personal, support becomes sales, and conversations shape success.The teams you could be joiningPhone Team Develops Voice and SMS solutions for seamless e-commerce customer support, integrating third-party telephony and enhancing voice automation.Apps Team Builds native apps connecting Gorgias to external services, including messaging (e.g., Gmail) and e-commerce (e.g., Shopify) integrations.Developer Relations Team Ensures a secure, well-documented API, enabling external developers to build and connect apps, and supporting a growing app ecosystem. Second, that team is in charge of providing authentication & authorization capacities to external and internal developers.Growth Team Manages the user journey from onboarding to billing, ensuring a seamless experience while preventing fraudsters from abusing the platform.In-App Analytics Team Creates in-product analytics and real-time processing features, supporting internal teams with advanced tooling and datasets.Streaming Infrastructure Team Builds a scalable data streaming platform, providing tooling, monitoring, and guidelines to propagate and aggregate data across multiple availability zonesWhat You'll DoTeam up with Product and Design to build clean, responsive, and super-fast features that solve real customer problems.Optimize our apps for speed and scalability, ensuring they work smoothly on any browserWrite clear, maintainable code, and follow best practices-while keeping things flexible and pragmatic.Work in an agile environment, collaborate on code reviews, and help us ship top-notch features quickly.Who You AreYou've got 5+ years of experience with TypeScript and React.You know the ins and outs of the frontend stack-CDN, Cache, bundlers (vite, webpack/rspack), test runners (jest/vitest), CI/CD.You've worked in high-traffic environments - where scalability and performance are crucial.You're comfortable balancing frontend and backend needs and can give thoughtful input on API design.You follow best practices, but you're not afraid to make smart trade-offs when necessary. You build scalable and reliable frontend applications:You leverage React composition model to build reusable, well tested and flexible components.You're familiar with modern async state handling (react-query).Inversion of control and the testing pyramid are familiar concepts to you.You know how to build great UIs that look good and feel even better, using modern CSS and UX principles.Nice to have: You're familiar with WebSockets.Bonus Points If You Have:Pnpm for toolingYou're familiar with frontend UI/UX scaling topics like design systemsYou're interested in frontend architecture and platform workInterview processOur interview process consists of 4 main steps and typically takes around two weeks from the initial screening to the offer stage, with feedback provided every 48 hours.Meet one of our tech recruiters (30 minutes)Meet two of our Engineering Managers (45 minutes)Technical Stage: live coding session (60 minutes) Meet the team (60 minutes)Meet the CTO and co-founder (30 minutes)After completing these steps, we conduct reference checks before extending an offer.Company Benefits and Perks5-week vacation plus 2 weeks RTTPaid sick leave 6 weeks full remote/yearPaid parental leave (16 weeks)50% of public transportation reimbursedMacBook ProPersonal credit card to buy lunches (we use Swile)We provide private health insurance (we use Alan)Get up to €700 to set up your workstation at home (working from home should feel breezy)Get up to €2000 of learning material and wellness support per year! This includes €1500 for learning material (such as books, courses, and individual coaching sessions) directly linked to your job scope, as well as a €500 wellness budget. Take advantage of these resources to grow in your role and prioritize your personal development and wellness.Every quarter, we organize an online company-wide summit to discuss where we're going and strengthen social bonds. Once per year we organize offsite team retreats and company retreats!Diversity & Inclusion at GorgiasWe celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. At Gorgias, we believe that diverse teams drive innovation and better decision-making. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other protected status.If you need accommodations to participate in the application or interview process, perform essential job functions, or access other employment benefits, please contact us at [email protected]. Let's grow together!

title: Digital Marketing Director

Together, our global staff help students from around the world develop the language skills they need to achieve their dreams.Are you ready for a dynamic role in a truly international environment? Are you passionate about digital marketing and strongly goal-oriented?As the Head of Marketing you will be at the heart of our mission to connect with more learners, working in a dynamic atmosphere while shaping our digital future. In this role, you will have the opportunity to:Unleash your creativityAnalyze dataDesign targeted campaignsThe everyday working language in our Paris office is French, however, this role requires excellent command of the English language as well to communicate with Global Leaders and Stakeholders. Full fluency (speaking, reading, writing) in both languages is required. Please submit your CV in English. CVs in French will not be considered. you love both spreadsheets and creative ideasA natural leader, you are comfortable in a dynamic and collaborative environmentExperienced in creating engaging campaigns and generating leadsStrong understanding of the French digital marketProven ability to lead multi-channel marketing strategies (performance, content, CRM, social, offline, and brand activations).Strong analytical mindset, able to connect marketing activities to lead generation and revenue impact.Experience in high-growth, competitive industries (e.g., travel, education, consumer services).Deep understanding of the French media landscape, including digital, influencer marketing, and traditional media.Fully fluent in French, used daily in the officeFully Fluent in English, required for global meetingsWhat EF offers:  Work in the heart of Paris Opportunities to travel internationallyDiscounts on EF programs for Staff and Staff Friends and FamilyFree use of EF Hello: a premium Language Learning AppTuition Reimbursement for continued EducationBe part of a mission-driven company that transforms lives through educationTeam events, kick-offs, and Holiday PartiesAt EF Language Abroad we are dedicated to our mission of opening the world through education, harnessing the power of language learning to deepen the connection between people across the globe. Ready to open the world through education? Apply now! About EF Education First Openness to the world and cultural understanding are key qualities for a successful journey. Since 1965, we have helped millions of learners travel, discover new cultures, and live unique experiences.Our immersive educational programs-focused on languages, travel, cultural exchange, and academic learning-turn dreams into international opportunities.By joining EF, you become part of a multicultural community active in over 50 countries, with hundreds of schools and offices worldwide. Our mission is to open the world through education. No matter your background or passions, we welcome you and hope you will share this vision with us.EF is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, committed to inclusion and belonging, regardless of origin, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, or experience.Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, with regional headquarters in Boston, London, São Paulo, Tokyo, Zurich, and more.EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults. All positions are subject to criminal background and/or reference checks, as applicable. #LI-MC2
